Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
$PSSessionOptionOverride = New-Object System.Management.Automation.Remoting.PSSessionOption -Property  @{'CancelTimeout'=15000;'OperationTimeout'=45000;'IdleTimeout'=60000;'OpenTimeout'=15000}
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```powershell
$PSSessionOptionOverride

OperationTimeout                  : 00:00:45
OpenTimeout                       : 00:00:15
CancelTimeout                     : 00:00:15
IdleTimeout                       : 00:01:00
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```powershell

$PSSessionOptionOverride                                                                                                                                                                            

OperationTimeout                  : 00:00:00.0045000
OpenTimeout                       : 00:00:00.0015000
CancelTimeout                     : 00:00:00.0015000
IdleTimeout                       : 00:00:00.0060000
```

----------------

```powershell
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: vinodc
comments.body: I believe in the 6.0.0 beta1, this correctly accepted values in milliseconds rather than 10^-7 seconds increments.

comments.author: JustinGrote
comments.body: FYI it's a duration property, so you can do string representations like '00:00:60' instead and it will translate to the proper amount of time.

title: Need to use 600000000 to set 60 seconds timeout in System.Management.Automation.Remoting.PSSessionOption
